title: Windows 8.1 with Bing - AKA CoreConnected x64
description:
Keys:

CoreConnected=TNPYB-DX84C-26HCV-33KJB-CWD6W
gvlkCoreConnected=3PY8R-QHNP9-W7XQD-G6DPH-3J2C9 (generated, not default)

Not much to say about this one, it's one of their new low-cost versions of Win8.1. I guess they're trying to subsidize the cost of development with ad revenue generated by more people using Bing.

This is a good source for re-installing on a bloated up system. OEMs love to install junk from 3rd party clients because they get paid to put them on your system. You only need your key, though, and you can simply re-install a clean version.

File info: X19-57272_SW_DVD9_NTRL_Win_with_Bing_8.1_64BIT_English_OEM.img
Size: 3.71 GB
SHA1: BDC1E5FDBC1FAD5FE26155BAB6DAB7D95F434DEA

Language - en-US (United States locale)

If you're interested in trying this on a VM or something and wish to activate, you would bring up admin prompt and run:
slmgr /ipk 3PY8R-QHNP9-W7XQD-G6DPH-3J2C9

That will install the gVLK, then you activate with something like Microsoft Toolkit.
